body:
I've tried watools.es and WART 1.7.1.0
I've received an SMS with my Whatsapp code, but when I confirm it (without the "-" in the middle), it says "An error occurred registering the registration code from Whatsapp" and in WART says "Verification code not accepted".
Now I don't know what to do. Could someone help me?

comment_data.body:
I'm tring to register today, but never got the message or voice call :/
A long time ago I did that.
That means it doesn't function?
I don't know. Wait someone comment to see if it works. I bought another SIM to test, but didin't receive. I'm waiting the "retry_after" to test again.
If you request code using WART and try to register the code using the API, you will get the mismatch error, as identity generated in WART is different to the identity generated using the API.

me neither, tried to register but didnt get any sms. tried using https://coderus.openrepos.net/whitesoft/whatsapp_sms, and got the sms, but got mismatch error.

edit: sorry, i mean to post this in yowsup. seems WhatsAPI also got the same problem.

Well guys, today I find the problem. Please, read the [exempleFunctional.php](https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/examples/exampleFunctional.php). Follow this guide to get the SMS from WhatsApp, but rembemer: **UNINSTALL WHATSAPP FROM YOUR PHONE**. I just can get the SMS without WhatsApp app in my phone.

Edit: [exempleRegister](https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/examples/exampleRegister.php)
@eliasjnior Good hint. But only applies to Android.

Could you explain what do you mean?

exampleFunctional.php is not a guide, it's a php file to show how to 
send whatsapp messages.

We need:

     $username = "**your phone number**"; // Telephone number including 
the country code without '+' or '00'.
it's clear.

     $password = "**server generated whatsapp password**"; // A server 
generated Password you received from WhatsApp. This can NOT be manually 
created
what's this? the 6-numbers code received by SMS?

     $identity = "**unique ID generated by WhatsApp client**"; // 
Obtained during registration with this API or using MissVenom 
(https://github.com/shirioko/MissVenom) to sniff from your phone.
If I couldn't register, I couldn't obtain this identity. Am I right?

     $nickname = "**your nickname**"; // This is the username (or 
nickname) displayed by WhatsApp clients.
it's clear.

$target = "**contact's phone number**"; // Destination telephone number 
including the country code without '+' or '00'.
it's clear

$debug = false; // Set this to true, to see debug mode.
it's clear

>
> Well guys, today I find the problem. Please, read the 
> exempleFunctional.php 
> <https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/blob/master/examples/exampleFunctional.php>. 
> Follow this guide to get the SMS from WhatsApp, but rembemer: 
> *UNINSTALL WHATSAPP FROM YOUR PHONE*. I just can get the SMS without 
> WhatsApp app in my phone.
>

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub 
> <https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/986#issuecomment-56969127>.
>
Sorry, was exempleRegister :P

Yes, I was trying to register with that file.
First I execute
$w->codeRequest('sms');
and I receive an SMS or a Call (I've tried 2 methods) on my phone

but after, when I put my code (for example 333-333) on codeRegister
$w->codeRegister('333333');
and execute the PHP, the page turns blank and nothing happens.
I don't see any message.

I'm trying to register a number that has never had whatsapp. May be a 
problem?

>
> Sorry, was exempleRegister :P
>

thanks @eliasjnior it's working. one more question, where do i get identity value?

i got this when requesting code,
```
Array ( 
	[method] => sms 
	[in] => 11*********36 
	[cc] => 60 
	[id] => %b1%02%*****************************************c8%04%91 
	[lg] => en 
	[lc] => MY 
	[token] => tg8d***********************************%3D 
	[sim_mcc] => 000 
	[sim_mnc] => 000 
) 
```
is the id is the identity value?

edit: added return values

Identity is a raw sha1 urlencoded string.

Register method has changed and probably soon its going to give you problems :)
alright. thanks a lot @mgp25 :)

Thanks a lot @eliasjnior ! I've could register and obtained the password. Now I'm configuring these data on exampleFunctional.php 

$username = "34691______";                      // Just registered phone
$password = "EsKBjFMbRJK________________";     // Password returned on exampleRegister.php
$identity = ""; // I've registered with empty identity and I keep it empty
$nickname = "C____";                          // Registered username
$target = "34658______";                   // Destination telephone number where I want to receive whatsapp test message
$debug = true;                                           // I wanna know what's going wrong
When I execute it, the page doesn't load. It says "conection reset by server". Have you succeed in sending a test message with this class?

use exampleFunctional.php or /test/whatsapp.php

check them out

Hola @mgp25 , también estoy probando http://www.whatsappea.me pero no me envía los mensajes.
Está funcionando?

Está basado en tu WhatsApp-Web-Client, verdad?

Hi @mgp25 , I'm trying http://www.whatsappea.me too but it doesn't send my messages. Is it working?

Is it based on your WhatsApp-Web-Client, isn't it?
@Pinazinho use watools.es instead. Updated code of whatsappea.me its on my github, the one uploaded to the website is outdated.

I've just achieved it! I'm sending and receiving messages by whatsapp. Now I'm going to try your WhatsApp-Web-Client.

Please, could you tell me what do you mean when you say:
"Register method has changed and probably soon its going to give you problems :)"
You mean that WhatsAPI isn't going to work soon?
can you please tell me new method i have same problem i used yousup as well as whatsapi

Hi... All,


I am not able to receive request code.
And in exampleRequest.php, I am using following code:

$username = "918010201735";
$identity = strtolower(urlencode(sha1($username, true)));
$w = new WhatsProt($username, $identity, "HDINT", true);
$w->codeRequest();

--------------------------exampleRequest.php ends here and should send a message to my number-----------

Execution Result display: 

Array
(
    [method] => sms
    [in] => 8010201735
    [cc] => 91
    [id] => %d3%a6%5c3r%b1%e2%ee%1f%db%cb%17%c3rs%b0%1c%bc%11%d5
    [lg] => hi
    [lc] => IN
    [token] => wa8F5qkL8bdGtxuuagmLDxf%2Bo2Y%3D
    [sim_mcc] => 000
    [sim_mnc] => 000
)
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail
    [reason] => old_version
)

------------------------------------------------------
No Message i got.
-----------------------------------



Please help me friends as i have been searching on this from 2 days.
Use https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official

Dear MGP25,

Firstly thanks for helping me.
Now i am using https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official

And I have done following change in exampleRegister.php

$debug = true;
$nickname = 'NEWTON';                       
$username = '918010201340'; 
$identity = strtolower(urlencode(sha1($username, true)));
echo "<pre>";
$w = new WhatsProt($username, $identity, $nickname, $debug);
$w->codeRequest('sms');
//$w->codeRegister('123456');   // commented


And I didn't get any message.
output i got is:

Array
(
    [in] => 8010201340
    [cc] => 91
    [id] => %6b%af%9e%29%a9%4a%7d%ba%d9%e6%7a%cb%7d%22%d8%5b
    [lg] => hi
    [lc] => IN
    [mcc] => 000
    [mnc] => 000
    [sim_mcc] => 404
    [sim_mnc] => 000
    [method] => sms
    [reason] => self-send-jailbroken
    [token] => EQdPYwC1me2y2bOMVpvu7vV1IRo%3D
    [network_radio_type] => 1
)
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => sent
    [length] => 6
    [method] => sms
    [retry_after] => 25205
)


Please help me.

First of all, I suggest you to read this: https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official/wiki/WhatsApp-Registration-Flow

After, you can read, in the Wiki again, the Number Registration: https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official/wiki/WhatsAPI-Documentation#number-registration

You don't have to urlencode, sha1, and others things with your identity. If I'm right, the identity is being saved in some folder. I always put the same as the username, as it's unique.

This is to run in CMD. you are trying to run this in Web what was made to
run in CMD. In this link that I sent you can take a look in wiki and have
something about number register. It shows how to register a number in Web
(not it CMD). Fgets is a function to get an file content, and STDIN is the
"file input", that is the keyboard.

It's invalid because you are trying to run this STDIN in web, that is
really invalid.

Voice: {status:fail, reason: no_routes, retry_after: 3600}

& By exampleRegister.php

Array
(
    [in] => 8010202508
    [cc] => 91
    [id] => %93%c6%7f%38%a5%c2%4b%02%a0%d8%9e%54%c8%e0%6f%5a
    [lg] => hi

)
stdClass Object
(
    [status] => fail

)

So i have to change sim every time & it is very tough to put sim inside phone every time.

So help me in both case:
1. no_routes
2. Sim in side mobile or not

title: Couldn't register a number in whatsapp
